post.author: jmarshall23
post.body:
First off take a breath and relax. Now look at everything you purposed for your mod idea, will any of them make the game more fun to play? There are already numerous mods that fix sounds, and more or less everything you have mentioned including remaking Doom 1 and 2 inside of Doom 3. Just because you move a old game to a current generation engine doesn't mean its going to be fun to play.

So what you should do is if you are serious about what you want to do you should type up a game design document. Look at something like this http://www.gamasutra.com/blogs/JasonBak ... eloper.php. Aside from the fact you haven't made your thoughts clear at all, a game design document will help you organize your ideas for yourself and the rest of us. Figure out if anything you mentioned will add more fun to the game. Instead of stupid stuff like sounds, and visuals, if you want to make doom 3 more fun look at creating new game mechanics. If your mod idea isn't fun with just boxes and spheres as visuals, it won't be fun to play with whatever estetics you mentioned.

My game design for the redesign of DOOM 1, 2, and 3...


DOOM 3 should balance light and darkness. It should be very atmospheric and emulate the feel of the Classic Resident Evil games.


DOOM 1 and 2 remade on the DOOM 3 engine... it should take advantage of the modern technology, such as non-center screen weapons. Reloading is a must, however it must be short quick reload animations nothing fancy, we don't need COD styled "LOOK AT ME TAKING FOREVER HURH HURH!" Goldeneye Reloading is an option. You could do Goldeneye N64 Reload Animations or Simple Quick Animations.

Iron Sights we need, not only to appeal to this generation... but to also make the game feel realistic.


Bunnyhopping, rocketjumping, strafejumping, and running 100 MPHS... that's a must!

We need tons of blood and gore but not to the point were the PC lags...


We need much more ragdoll physics implemented.

Destructible enviroments.

Make the monsters look 10000X scarier. It's 2012... we can make high-poly models of the sprites right guys?

Also, we can take a vote... I believe in a democratic system..


All in favor of center screen weapons for DOOM 1 and 2 Remake say: DOOM IS FUCKING AWESOME!

All those NOT in favor of center screen weapons for DOOM 1 and 2 Remake say: DOOM 3 IS AWESOME!

post.author: Gazado
post.body:
As a basic level of respect for the team who worked on Classic Doom 3 mod, please do not use the mod as a base of any kind. Please do download, play through and look at the base assets to learn how we put it together, however please do not redistribute the mod assets as your own work, in whole or in part, with another modification.

We spent 3-4 years working on the project in our spare time, I am sure some members of the team would be happy for you to make use of their work on an individual basis, however there will also be members who are not. As a single, complete project, it would be most sensible to not make use of it's creative assets as it would be impossible to obtain direct permission from the individual team members (I don't have all of their contact details).

To reiterate, please do look at the assets and learn from them to create your own, new assets, but please do not re-use or release the Classic Doom 3 work in any new projects.

post.author: Gazado
post.body:
As a basic level of respect for the team who worked on Classic Doom 3 mod, please do not use the mod as a base of any kind. Please do download, play through and look at the base assets to learn how we put it together, however please do not redistribute the mod assets as your own work, in whole or in part, with another modification.

We spent 3-4 years working on the project in our spare time, I am sure some members of the team would be happy for you to make use of their work on an individual basis, however there will also be members who are not. As a single, complete project, it would be most sensible to not make use of it's creative assets as it would be impossible to obtain direct permission from the individual team members (I don't have all of their contact details).

To reiterate, please do look at the assets and learn from them to create your own, new assets, but please do not re-use or release the Classic Doom 3 work in any new projects.
